video.title: M*A*S*H
video.synopsis: This beloved show inspired by Robert Altman's Oscar-winning Korean War satire follows a mobile Army surgical hospital tasked with tending the wounded.

episodes.synopsis: While their C.O. is away, Hawkeye pens a letter home describing life at the 4077th and raises funds to send the Swamp's Korean houseboy stateside.
episodes.title: Pilot

episodes.synopsis: Desperate for critical medical supplies, Hawkeye and Trapper turn to the black market, bartering away Henry's antique desk as payment.
episodes.title: To Market, To Market

episodes.synopsis: Aided by a little trickery from Hawkeye, Trapper enters a boxing match to prevent an attractive nurse from being transferred out of the 4077th.
episodes.title: Requiem for a Lightweight

episodes.synopsis: The 4077th comes under the watchful eye of top brass when Frank and Hot Lips file a complaint about Hawkeye's promotion to chief surgeon.
episodes.title: Chief Surgeon Who?

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye's cunning schemes backfire when he tries to help a Korean girl break free from the American G.I. who has ensnared her.
episodes.title: The Moose

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye brazenly turns the tables on a military film unit sent to the 4077th to shoot a propaganda-filled documentary about the Army's MASH units.
episodes.title: Yankee Doodle Doctor

episodes.synopsis: Desperate for a little rest and relaxation, Hawkeye fakes a mental breakdown -- but not everybody is buying his little charade.
episodes.title: Bananas, Crackers and Nuts

episodes.synopsis: Convinced that his wife back home is leaving him for another man, a helicopter pilot takes increasingly drastic measures to wrangle a pass stateside.
episodes.title: Cowboy

episodes.synopsis: When insufferably by-the-book Frank takes charge of the 4077th, Hawkeye and Trapper slip off to Tokyo to convince Henry to return.
episodes.title: Henry, Please Come Home

episodes.synopsis: Under a cloud of suspicion, Hawkeye works to uncover the real culprit when valuables stolen from around the 4077th turn up in his foot locker.
episodes.title: I Hate a Mystery

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and Trapper secretly use Frank's blood for a procedure, but the recipient soon shows signs of a dangerous infection.
episodes.title: Germ Warfare

episodes.synopsis: In a letter to his father, Hawkeye describes the Christmastime shenanigans at the 4077th, including his trip to the front lines dressed as Santa.
episodes.title: Dear Dad

episodes.synopsis: It's up to Hawkeye to break the impasse when the nurses of the 4077th go on a romance "strike" until someone takes clumsy nurse Edwina on a date.
episodes.title: Edwina

episodes.synopsis: After his girlfriend dumps him, Radar turns to Hawkeye and Trapper for help winning the heart of a sophisticated new nurse in camp.
episodes.title: Love Story

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye gets in over his head when he invents a fictional captain in order to donate money and medical supplies to an orphanage.
episodes.title: Tuttle

episodes.synopsis: After operating on a colonel who has a reckless disregard for the lives of his men, Hawkeye and Trapper scheme to get him sent stateside.
episodes.title: The Ringbanger

episodes.synopsis: One of Hawkeye's childhood friends is hit by a stray bullet, and Hawkeye discovers one of his patients lied about his age in order to enlist.
episodes.title: Sometimes You Hear the Bullet

episodes.synopsis: In another letter home, Hawkeye relates more of the 4077th's antics, including Frank and Hot Lips's affair and an impostor who poses as a surgeon.
episodes.title: Dear Dad, Again

episodes.synopsis: During a frigid cold spell, everybody tries to get their hands on a pair of long underwear sent to Hawkeye by his father.
episodes.title: The Long-John Flap

episodes.synopsis: While the 4077th listens to the Army-Navy game, an unexploded bomb lands in the middle of camp -- and it falls to Hawkeye and Trapper to disarm it.
episodes.title: The Army-Navy Game

episodes.synopsis: After he openly criticizes Frank's competence as a surgeon, Hawkeye begins to have doubts about his own surgical abilities.
episodes.title: Sticky Wicket

episodes.synopsis: When Frank and Hot Lips put in for a transfer, Hawkeye and Trapper trick them into staying by pretending to find gold in the hills near the 4077th.
episodes.title: Major Fred C. Dobbs

episodes.synopsis: When rumors of a cease-fire reach the 4077th, everyone celebrates and prepares to leave for home -- except for Trapper, who doubts the news.
episodes.title: Cease-Fire

episodes.synopsis: A traveling USO troupe arrives at the 4077th to entertain the camp, while Henry anxiously awaits word of his pregnant wife, who is in labor back home.
episodes.title: Showtime

episodes.synopsis: Henry orders the unit to behave when Gen. Clayton sends a psychiatrist to investigate reports of the 4077th's outrageous antics.
episodes.title: Divided We Stand

episodes.synopsis: When an ammo dump near the camp attracts an inept bomber, Hawkeye and Trapper try to stop Major Burns and Houlihan from getting an anti-aircraft gun.
episodes.title: 5 O'Clock Charlie

episodes.synopsis: In his weekly report, Radar describes Hawkeye falling in love with a nurse; a POW who goes crazy in the OR; and an attempt to transfer Klinger.
episodes.title: Radar's Report

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and Trapper are outraged to discover that the U.S. Army mistakenly shelled a friendly South Korean village and refuses to take responsibility.
episodes.title: For the Good of the Outfit

episodes.synopsis: After operating nonstop for more than a day, Hawkeye flips out and, among other things, tries to give North Korea the camp's latrine.
episodes.title: Dr. Pierce and Mr. Hyde

episodes.synopsis: When a wounded 5-year-old wanders into the camp, he wins the hearts of everyone -- especially Trapper, who decides he wants to adopt the child.
episodes.title: Kim

episodes.synopsis: When a G.I. wants to marry a Korean, Hawkeye cuts through the army's red tape by blackmailing the official who stands in the way of the wedding.
episodes.title: L.I.P. (Local Indigenous Personnel)

episodes.synopsis: Frank disapproves of the 4077th's high jinks, so he brings Henry up on charges and enlists Hot Lips to hold Hawkeye and Trapper under house arrest.
episodes.title: The Trial of Henry Blake

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye handles a racist patient with an unexploded grenade in his chest; Hot Lips and Frank continue their affair; Henry receives a home movie.
episodes.title: Dear Dad...Three

episodes.synopsis: When a sniper opens fire on the camp, a kink is thrown into the operations of the 4077th that intrudes upon the unit's medical and social plans.
episodes.title: The Sniper

episodes.synopsis: A flu epidemic strikes the 4077th, leaving only Hawkeye and Hot Lips in good enough shape to care for their fallen comrades and the wounded.
episodes.title: Carry On, Hawkeye

episodes.synopsis: When Hawkeye and Trapper get their request for a much needed incubator refused, they buck the military brass and disrupt a press conference.
episodes.title: The Incubator

episodes.synopsis: Radar accidentally hits a local with his jeep; Hawkeye and Trapper spar with their officers during a "medical conference" -- a game of poker.
episodes.title: Deal Me Out

episodes.synopsis: A letter from a friend causes Hot Lips to feel depressed about her life and request a transfer, causing turmoil in the camp.
episodes.title: Hot Lips and Empty Arms

episodes.synopsis: After the unit saves his son, a general rewards the 4077th with a new officer's club, but Hawkeye and Trapper think everyone should get to enjoy it.
episodes.title: Officers Only

episodes.synopsis: Family man Henry has the hots for a 20-year-old girl he met while on leave in Tokyo -- and she has the hots for Hawkeye.
episodes.title: Henry in Love

episodes.synopsis: After months of waiting, Hawkeye learns that he must wade through an ocean of red tape to get a desperately needed pair of new boots.
episodes.title: For Want of a Boot

episodes.synopsis: When a G.I. is caught trying to go AWOL, Hawkeye and Trapper try to boost the young man's self-image by getting him a nose job.
episodes.title: Operation Noselift

episodes.synopsis: A Korean family claims the compound was built on their farm; a pregnant local girl arrives at the 4077th and names Radar as the baby's father.
episodes.title: The Chosen People

episodes.synopsis: During a lull in the fighting, Hawkeye and Trapper operate on Frank's hernia, and Henry delivers a baby before the battle resumes.
episodes.title: As You Were

episodes.synopsis: When the enemy cuts supply lines to the 4077th in the middle of winter, the unit is forced to conserve heat, water, food and medical necessities.
episodes.title: Crisis

episodes.synopsis: Frank wants to turn in a wounded man for being gay, but Trapper teaches him that everyone, including Frank, has secrets to hide.
episodes.title: George

episodes.synopsis: A delivery of mail from home brings Hawkeye a sweater, Frank good news about his stocks and Henry his wife's checkbook to balance.
episodes.title: Mail Call

episodes.synopsis: Burns is investigated by two crazy intelligence men, one who is convinced he is a communist, and the other who is sure that Frank is a fascist.
episodes.title: A Smattering of Intelligence

episodes.synopsis: Gen. Bartford Steele arrives at the 4077th and surprises everyone with his loony antics -- like threatening to have Hawkeye court-martialed.
episodes.title: The General Flipped at Dawn

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye, Trapper, Frank, Radar and Klinger go into enemy territory to make an exchange of wounded POWs with the Chinese.
episodes.title: Rainbow Bridge

episodes.synopsis: While Henry is away, Frank is left in charge and assigns Hawkeye a dubious honor. As officer of the Day, Hawkeye tries to aid a Korean prisoner.
episodes.title: Officer of the Day

episodes.synopsis: A famous general visits the camp and then dies in Hot Lips's tent, so it is up to Hawkeye and Trapper to rescue her (and his) reputation.
episodes.title: Iron Guts Kelly

episodes.synopsis: A siege occurs, and the wounded pour into the camp in need of medical help as artillery explodes nearby and war planes scream overhead.
episodes.title: O.R.

episodes.synopsis: Spring is in the air! Klinger's girlfriend accepts his proposal; Radar falls for a nurse; Frank and Hot Lips continue their passionate affair.
episodes.title: Springtime

episodes.synopsis: Trapper learns that he has an ulcer and must decide if he'll try to get a medical discharge, which could be his ticket home.
episodes.title: Check-Up

episodes.synopsis: Father Mulcahy and Henry receive troubling news from the home front; Hawkeye is asked to perform a circumcision at a Jewish bris.
episodes.title: Life With Father

episodes.synopsis: While Henry's away, Frank orders the camp to jump on the sobriety wagon, outlawing alcohol -- with hazardous results.
episodes.title: Alcoholics Unanimous

episodes.synopsis: With the threat of an enemy attack growing, the nurses are evacuated, and Henry realizes that he has underestimated their value to the 4077th.
episodes.title: There Is Nothing Like a Nurse

episodes.synopsis: After 11 straight days of the same food, Hawkeye figures out a way to get spare ribs from his favorite restaurant in Chicago.
episodes.title: Adam's Ribs

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye tapes a letter home describing a Turk who goes wild in the O.R. and a wounded soldier that the 4077th has apparently lost.
episodes.title: A Full Rich Day

episodes.synopsis: Radar is bitten by a dog and might have rabies; a patient arrives with no apparent injuries but has lost the ability to move.
episodes.title: Mad Dogs and Servicemen

episodes.synopsis: When a lamb is given to the camp as a gift, Radar tries to save the animal from becoming a holiday meal and secretly arranges for it to be sent home.
episodes.title: Private Charles Lamb

episodes.synopsis: During an artillery shelling by U.S. Bombs, Hot Lips and Trapper are stuck in the supply room and Radar tries to get the camp out of the line of fire.
episodes.title: Bombed

episodes.synopsis: The activities of the week, including Col. Blake's lecture on sex and an orphanage's barbecue, are featured on the camp bulletin board.
episodes.title: Bulletin Board

episodes.synopsis: In Tokyo, Hawkeye and Trapper meet a veteran of three wars who turns to alcohol when confronted with incoming casualties.
episodes.title: The Consultant

episodes.synopsis: Frank snaps a towel at Hawkeye, and Hawkeye's response gets him placed under house arrest, where he is treated like a hero instead of a troublemaker.
episodes.title: House Arrest

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye, Hot Lips and Klinger make an emergency trip to an aid station at the front lines, where they must work together under terrible conditions.
episodes.title: Aid Station

episodes.synopsis: Trapper and Hawkeye attempt to bring a Korean medic together with his family and deal with a young G.I. who wants to marry a local girl for money.
episodes.title: Love and Marriage

episodes.synopsis: Gen. MacArthur's impending visit turns the camp upside down, as Klinger schemes to win a discharge and Henry tries to make the 4077th look sane.
episodes.title: Big Mac

episodes.synopsis: Money is the root of the camp's evils when Hawkeye has leftover money from the payroll, Klinger tries to bribe Henry and Frank buys Hot Lips pearls.
episodes.title: Payday

episodes.synopsis: When thieves strike at the 4077th and attempt to steal penicillin, intelligence officer Col. Flagg is sent to investigate.
episodes.title: White Gold

episodes.synopsis: Henry Blake gets his discharge, which means that Frank is left in charge. The soldiers of the 4077th say their good-byes as Henry heads for home.
episodes.title: Abyssinia, Henry

episodes.synopsis: Trapper is discharged while Hawkeye is on R & R. After missing him at the airport, Hawkeye makes fast friends with his replacement, B.J. Hunnicutt.
episodes.title: Welcome to Korea Part 1

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and Radar make their way back to the 4077th with new surgeon B.J. Hunnicutt, who gets his first taste of war when they stop to aid casualties.
episodes.title: Welcome to Korea Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Frank Burns's dream finally comes true when he takes command of the 4077th, only to be replaced by the gruff but loveable Col. Sherman Potter.
episodes.title: Change of Command

episodes.synopsis: A long cold night of heavy artillery has the camp on edge, as Frank raids Margaret's tent searching for his love letters and a sentry shoots Klinger.
episodes.title: It Happened One Night

episodes.synopsis: When the Army mistakenly declares Hawkeye dead, he negotiates red tape trying to get the error fixed ... and notify his father that he's still alive.
episodes.title: The Late Captain Pierce

episodes.synopsis: The doctors earn bottles of Scotch in exchange for some hush-hush toe surgery, and the camp trades penicillin for a tank to deal with a sniper.
episodes.title: Hey, Doc

episodes.synopsis: A broken-down bus leaves Col. Potter, Hawkeye, B.J., Frank and Radar stranded in unfamiliar territory until they get help from a surprising source.
episodes.title: The Bus

episodes.synopsis: A homesick Col. Potter writes to his wife on their anniversary, and Radar presents the former cavalry soldier with a new horse.
episodes.title: Dear Mildred

episodes.synopsis: In addition to a regular load of casualties, the 4077th hosts a group of displaced Korean orphans and deal with an expectant mother.
episodes.title: The Kids

episodes.synopsis: A wounded soldier who believes he's Jesus Christ brings dueling opinions from psychiatrist Sidney Freeman and loony intelligence officer Col. Flagg.
episodes.title: Quo Vadis, Captain Chandler?

episodes.synopsis: B.J.'s letter to his wife tells of Frank's latest blunder, Father Mulcahy's visit from a senior chaplain and Klinger's recent escape attempt.
episodes.title: Dear Peggy

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye clashes with a stubborn colonel, B.J. helps a friend whose wife had an affair, and a paranoid Frank combs the compound for saboteurs.
episodes.title: Of Moose and Men

episodes.synopsis: Col. Potter's soldier of the month contest coincides with an outbreak of hemorrhagic fever that has a delirious Frank rewriting his will.
episodes.title: Soldier of the Month

episodes.synopsis: When a wounded colonel's prized gun disappears from the camp safe, Hawkeye and B.J. discover that Frank took it and plot to get it back.
episodes.title: The Gun

episodes.synopsis: The mail delivers lingerie to Hot Lips, sobering news from Frank's wife and word that Col. Potter will be a grandfather.
episodes.title: Mail Call...Again

episodes.synopsis: Radar pulls strings and even enlists Hawkeye in his mission to get Col. Potter a regular supply of a rare commodity: tomato juice.
episodes.title: The Price of Tomato Juice

episodes.synopsis: Radar's letter to his mother features recent news of the 4077th, including a camp foot inspection and Col. Potter's embarrassing shrapnel wound.
episodes.title: Dear Ma

episodes.synopsis: A doubtful Hawkeye and B.J. take Col. Potter's advice and try to befriend Frank, with some unexpected consequences.
episodes.title: Der Tag

episodes.synopsis: After a jeep accident leaves him with a concussion, Hawkeye wanders to the home of a Korean family, who attempt to care for him until help arrives.
episodes.title: Hawkeye

episodes.synopsis: When Frank makes arrangements to sell the camp's garbage, Hawkeye buys a little to drop on a visiting colonel responsible for a number of casualties.
episodes.title: Some 38th Parallels

episodes.synopsis: When Frank is made acting C.O., he charges Hawkeye with mutiny, but everyone has different memories of the underlying event at his court-martial.
episodes.title: The Novocaine Mutiny

episodes.synopsis: A helicopter pilot who's determined to set a service record is permanently grounded after being wounded and diagnosed with diabetes.
episodes.title: Smilin' Jack

episodes.synopsis: A nurse temporarily assigned to the 4077th is an old flame of Hawkeye's, but his feelings are dashed when she announces that she's married.
episodes.title: The More I See You

episodes.synopsis: As if a sudden influx of wounded isn't stressful enough, the 4077th doctors face supply shortages, a fire and a rainstorm.
episodes.title: Deluge

episodes.synopsis: Members of the 4077th offer poignant answers in an episode of interviews by veteran war correspondent Clete Roberts.
episodes.title: The Interview

episodes.synopsis: Rumors spread that the 4077th must relocate due to approaching Chinese, but with a patient who can’t be moved, Hawkeye faces a tough decision.
episodes.title: Bug Out Part 1

episodes.synopsis: When the 4077th bugs out to avoid the advancing Chinese, Hawkeye, Hot Lips and Radar stay behind to care for a patient in critical condition.
episodes.title: Bug Out Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Hot Lips surprises the camp with news of her engagement to an officer stationed in Tokyo. The news is a hard blow for Frank to absorb.
episodes.title: Margaret's Engagement

episodes.synopsis: While helping the nurses fix their stove, Hawkeye is temporarily blinded and learns to see the camp in a completely different way.
episodes.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind

episodes.synopsis: To repay a poker debt, a sergeant forges promotion papers and makes arrangements for Radar to rise to the rank of lieutenant.
episodes.title: Lt. Radar O'Reilly

episodes.synopsis: In order to allow a nurse private time with her husband -- a soldier who is paying a surprise visit -- her fellow nurses are forced to share a tent.
episodes.title: The Nurses

episodes.synopsis: While Hot Lips is detained outside of the camp helping a Korean woman give birth, Potter calls in Col. Flagg to investigate her "disappearance."
episodes.title: The Abduction of Margaret Houlihan

episodes.synopsis: Camp psychiatrist Sidney Freedman pays a visit and, feeling blue, pens a letter to Sigmund Freud; a mystery prankster disrupts the unit.
episodes.title: Dear Sigmund

episodes.synopsis: Father Mulcahy gets a taste of the war up close when he insists on accompanying Radar on a trip to a first aid station at the battle front.
episodes.title: Mulcahy's War

episodes.synopsis: A wounded, American-educated North Korean surgeon arrives at the 4077th, and Hawkeye and B.J. do their best to conceal his identity.
episodes.title: The Korean Surgeon

episodes.synopsis: After 24 hours of performing surgery, Hawkeye and Potter go to help at a Korean hospital. Later, returning to camp, they're caught in an enemy attack.
episodes.title: Hawkeye Get Your Gun

episodes.synopsis: While Potter is away, two of his favorite females fall ill -- Hot Lips and his horse, Sophie. Hot Lips chooses Hawkeye over Frank to be her surgeon.
episodes.title: The Colonel's Horse

episodes.synopsis: When the camp's good luck charm is removed, strange things happen, so Potter allows a local civilian to perform a Korean ritual to oust bad spirits.
episodes.title: Exorcism

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye starts having nightmares and begins sleepwalking, making him confront the unpleasant reality of participating in a war.
episodes.title: Hawk's Nightmare

episodes.synopsis: Radar enrolls in a correspondence course, and aspiring to become a writer, he adds some flourishes to the weekly report.
episodes.title: The Most Unforgettable Characters

episodes.synopsis: Searching for a crossword puzzle answer, Hawkeye calls a friend in the Navy, who misinterprets and makes an emergency visit with his superior officer.
episodes.title: 38 Across

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and B.J. help the camp ping pong champ, who was forcibly conscripted into the Korean army; Potter learns unsavory news about a war buddy.
episodes.title: Ping Pong

episodes.synopsis: Radar brings comfort to a former college football star from Iowa who loses his will to live when his leg is amputated due to a severe injury.
episodes.title: End Run

episodes.synopsis: B.J. is unfaithful to his wife while consoling a nurse who received a "Dear Jane" letter and wrestles with the decision of whether or not to confess.
episodes.title: Hanky Panky

episodes.synopsis: Father Mulcahy comes down with hepatitis, and Hawkeye must inoculate the staff while he suffers from psychosomatic back pains.
episodes.title: Hepatitis

episodes.synopsis: A general aims to take Hawkeye from the 4077th to become his personal physician; Radar cares for a soldier's war baby after he is shipped back home.
episodes.title: The General's Practitioner

episodes.synopsis: When a favorite film, meant to boost the unit's sagging morale, arrives at the 4077th, the camp turns it into a special event.
episodes.title: Movie Tonight

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye goes after a pilot who sells souvenirs made from war materials when his business becomes the cause of injuries to his young Korean "helpers."
episodes.title: Souvenirs

episodes.synopsis: After working feverishly on a large group of wounded, Hawkeye and company deal with their patients' problems in post op.
episodes.title: Post Op

episodes.synopsis: Hot Lips and her fiancé tie the knot, but not before Hawkeye and B.J. have left their unique imprint on the festivities.
episodes.title: Margaret's Marriage

episodes.synopsis: Major Frank Burns flips out when he finds out that his former flame, Margaret "Hot Lips" Houlihan, has returned from Tokyo R&R with a wedding band.
episodes.title: Fade Out, Fade In - Part 1

episodes.synopsis: After Burns goes off the deep end, the 4077th adjusts to his replacement: A stuffy Boston doctor named Major Charles Emerson Winchester III.
episodes.title: Fade Out, Fade In - Part 2

episodes.synopsis: When Radar is wounded, Hawkeye lashes out with guilt. The two have a bitter falling out, causing Radar to question his high opinion of Hawkeye.
episodes.title: Fallen Idol

episodes.synopsis: Captain Hunnicutt's old buddy Leo is a practical joker whose prank goes too far when he has B.J. arrested for disrespecting a general.
episodes.title: Last Laugh

episodes.synopsis: Despondent over sending a soldier back into combat, psychologist Sidney Freedman visits the 4077th to heal his wounds -- both physical and emotional.
episodes.title: War of Nerves

episodes.synopsis: While Hawkeye spends the weekend in Tokyo, Charles tapes a rant to his parents describing the 4077th's over-the-top antics.
episodes.title: The Winchester Tapes

episodes.synopsis: The camp makes the best of a light bulb shortage by reading a murder mystery by candlelight, and Charles nearly kills a patient with the wrong drugs.
episodes.title: The Light That Failed

episodes.synopsis: Ladies' man Hawkeye falls hard for a beautiful Korean aristocrat on a mission to help Korean refugees; Margaret thinks Donald is cheating on her.
episodes.title: In Love and War

episodes.synopsis: Winchester takes advantage of the locals when the Army changes military scrip, while Klinger tries to leave Korea again by applying to West Point.
episodes.title: Change Day

episodes.synopsis: Hard-hearted Major Houlihan asks Potter to transfer an overly emotional nurse; meanwhile B.J. and Hawkeye try to talk Radar out of getting a tatoo.
episodes.title: Images

episodes.synopsis: Col. Potter thinks the 4077th is in need of exercise, so he organizes an Olympics-style event, with a three-day pass in lieu of medals.
episodes.title: The M*A*S*H Olympics

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye's in deep trouble with a by-the-book colonel who threatens court-martial; Klinger meets a wounded soldier from Toledo, his hometown.
episodes.title: The Grim Reaper

episodes.synopsis: On their way to another hospital, Hawkeye and Hot Lips get lost. Forced to hide behind enemy lines, the terrified duo seek comfort in close quarters.
episodes.title: Comrades in Arms - Part 1

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and Margaret are lost in enemy territory, the 4077th is worried, and B.J. disobeys Potter's direct orders and heads out to find his friends.
episodes.title: Comrades in Arms - Part 2

episodes.synopsis: B.J. and Hawkeye borrow money from Charles when Army pay is delayed, then scheme up a poker tournament to wipe out their debt.
episodes.title: The Merchant of Korea

episodes.synopsis: Driven nuts by Charles's bad French horn playing, Hawkeye and B.J. retaliate by not bathing. Col. Potter puts a wounded patient on suicide watch.
episodes.title: The Smell of Music

episodes.synopsis: Sick of inferior surgical equipment, Hawkeye asks a local craftsman to make a much-needed clamp; meanwhile, Margaret loses her wedding band.
episodes.title: Patent 4077

episodes.synopsis: Father Mulcahy and Klinger try to recover a batch of stolen penicillin, and a hard-hearted major insists recovering soldiers head back into combat.
episodes.title: Tea and Empathy

episodes.synopsis: Tempers flare during another marathon surgery session, but Radar cools the doctors' hot heads by spinning some new records over the intercom.
episodes.title: Your Hit Parade

episodes.synopsis: When Margaret thinks she's pregnant, Hawkeye helps her make a proper diagnosis by asking Radar to volunteer his pet bunny for the "rabbit test."
episodes.title: What's Up Doc?

episodes.synopsis: Klinger gets a "Dear John" letter, Radar learns his mom is dating, a note from home has B.J. jealous, and Hawkeye gets another soldier's love letter.
episodes.title: Mail Call Three

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye is traded to the 8063rd for a loudmouth surgeon and a jovial nurse -- an old friend of Margaret's -- as part of a temporary exchange program.
episodes.title: Temporary Duty

episodes.synopsis: Someone in the camp is submitting negative reports about Col. Potter to Army headquarters, so he decides to call it quits and finally retire.
episodes.title: Potter's Retirement

episodes.synopsis: When Major Winchester takes on a marathon surgery session, he stays awake by popping pep pills; meanwhile, Radar's pet mouse trains for a big race.
episodes.title: Dr. Winchester and Mr. Hyde

episodes.synopsis: When the camp gets a batch of bad morphine, the doctors use an unusual pain treatment, and Klinger trains a corporal who may be insane.
episodes.title: Major Topper

episodes.synopsis: When Potter goes to Seoul, Hawkeye begrudgingly takes charge of the 4077th and struggles to keep his temper in check.
episodes.title: Commander Pierce

episodes.synopsis: Bad news abounds when peace talks break down and Hawkeye, B.J. and Charles learn that surgeons now need more service points to return home.
episodes.title: Peace on Us

episodes.synopsis: Potter takes a liking to the friendly Col. Lillian Rayburn, who visits the 4077th for inspection, but Radar thinks their relationship is improper.
episodes.title: Lil

episodes.synopsis: In a flashback episode, members of the 4077th talk to television correspondent Clete Roberts about their memories of life in Korea.
episodes.title: Our Finest Hour - Part 1

episodes.synopsis: Reporter Clete Roberts interviews the staff about their lives, and a series of flashbacks highlights characters from earlier seasons.
episodes.title: Our Finest Hour - Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Charles is so angry over a losing a chance at a prestigious position back home that he refuses to talk to anyone in the 4077th.
episodes.title: The Billfold Syndrome

episodes.synopsis: When a heat wave hits the 4077th, Hawkeye and B.J. relax in a bathtub, Klinger pretends he's insane, and Radar comes down with tonsillitis.
episodes.title: None Like It Hot

episodes.synopsis: During a freezing windstorm, Charles asks Klinger to drive him to Seoul so he can vacation in Tokyo as planned, but they get lost.
episodes.title: They Call the Wind Korea

episodes.synopsis: Charles's ego is even more inflated than usual when a photojournalist comes to interview him after he saves a dying patient.
episodes.title: Major Ego

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye struggles to save a hypothermic patient during a cold front, and a land mine explosion damages Klinger's hearing.
episodes.title: Baby, It's Cold Outside

episodes.synopsis: Life at the 4077th is shown from the perspective of a wounded soldier with an injury that's left him unable to speak.
episodes.title: Point of View

episodes.synopsis: A North Korean spy poses as Charles's houseboy to get intel on the 4077th, but all he learns is that the unit is incompetent.
episodes.title: Dear Comrade

episodes.synopsis: When the unit runs low on surgical anesthetic at a critical time, Father Mulcahy rounds up items to trade on the black market.
episodes.title: Out of Gas

episodes.synopsis: Margaret finds herself in the midst of a quickly escalating practical joke war with B.J. and Hawkeye, with Charles egging everyone on.
episodes.title: An Eye for a Tooth

episodes.synopsis: In a letter to his sister at Christmastime, a depressed Father Mulcahy reflects on the fact that he feels useless around the 4077th.
episodes.title: Dear Sis

episodes.synopsis: A homesick B.J. tends to an elderly man with pneumonia and forms a bond with his family, who asks for help finding their missing son.
episodes.title: B.J. Papa San

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye flirts with an attractive doctor who's visiting from Sweden but balks when she demonstrates how skilled she is as a surgeon.
episodes.title: Inga

episodes.synopsis: Col. Potter's beloved horse, Sophie, goes missing. Meanwhile, Hawkeye and B.J. help a young man hide from the South Korean army.
episodes.title: The Price

episodes.synopsis: Charles is miffed when a very young surgeon visits and shows him up, while Potter, feeling out of sorts, refuses to get out of bed.
episodes.title: The Young and the Restless

episodes.synopsis: Margaret invites an old friend to weigh in on procedural changes at the 4077th, but he's more interested in romancing the newly divorced nurse.
episodes.title: Hot Lips Is Back in Town

episodes.synopsis: When Potter moves the unit to a cave during a shelling, Hawkeye is forced to admit that he suffers from claustrophobia.
episodes.title: C.A.V.E.

episodes.synopsis: When Hawkeye breaks protocol, an angry corporal accuses him of being a communist and asks Charles to spy on him.
episodes.title: Rally Round the Flagg, Boys

episodes.synopsis: When Potter fails to talk another colonel out of a dangerous mission, B.J. and Hawkeye come up with a plan to sideline him.
episodes.title: Preventative Medicine

episodes.synopsis: After a bad breakfast at the mess tent, Hawkeye retreats to Rosie's, where he's eventually joined by the rest of the camp.
episodes.title: A Night at Rosie's

episodes.synopsis: While Klinger romances a nurse he meets at Rosie's, Charles tries to transform a Korean working girl into a refined lady.
episodes.title: Ain't Love Grand

episodes.synopsis: When B.J. wants to organize a party for the 4077th's family members back in the U.S., Hawkeye has to convince everyone to participate.
episodes.title: The Party

episodes.synopsis: While recuperating at the 4077th, an accident-prone soldier turns out to be a culinary genius, and Hawkeye and BJ conspire to keep him around.
episodes.title: Too Many Cooks

episodes.synopsis: The 4077th rallies around Margaret when a visiting congressional aide's investigation accuses her of being a communist sympathizer.
episodes.title: Are You Now, Margaret?

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye tries to protect a wounded Korean woman from Lt. Park, a Korean officer who claims she's a guerrilla and intends to interrogate her.
episodes.title: Guerilla My Dreams

episodes.synopsis: Radar returns from leave in Tokyo to news that his Uncle Ed has passed away, resulting in his discharge from the Army.
episodes.title: Goodbye Radar - Part 1

episodes.synopsis: Radar prepares to return to the States but can't help noticing how much he's still needed around the 4077th.
episodes.title: Goodbye Radar - Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Klinger and BJ begin to chafe in the aftermath of Radar's discharge, and BJ's rage leads to a drunken confrontation with Hawkeye.
episodes.title: Period of Adjustment

episodes.synopsis: Father Mulcahy has an uncomfortable encounter with an ambitious visiting nurse. Meanwhile, the 4077th water supply begins to run low.
episodes.title: Nurse Doctor

episodes.synopsis: Klinger's offer to help a Korean girl leads to a misunderstanding with her mother, and Hawkeye regrets making a promise to a dying soldier.
episodes.title: Private Finance

episodes.synopsis: Charles returns from Tokyo with a hangover and a suspicion loss of memory. Meanwhile, an outbreak of hemorrhagic fever strikes the 4077th.
episodes.title: Mr. & Mrs. Who?

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and BJ get lost behind enemy lines while transporting antibiotics back to the 4077th and run across a North Korean soldier ready to surrender.
episodes.title: The Yalu Brick Road

episodes.synopsis: An on-screen clock counts down as BJ races to replace a GI's damaged aorta with a replacement harvested from a dead fellow soldier.
episodes.title: Life Time

episodes.synopsis: In a letter home to his Uncle Abdul, Klinger describes the nutty tasks he's forced to perform for the officers of the 4077th.
episodes.title: Dear Uncle Abdul

episodes.synopsis: The doctors become bartenders when a brawl lands Rosie in the hospital, and Father Mulcahy hopes once again for a promotion to captain.
episodes.title: Captains Outrageous

episodes.synopsis: A feud erupts between BJ and Charles when they're asked to contribute an article for a medical journal; Margaret's new boyfriend pays a visit.
episodes.title: Stars and Stripes

episodes.synopsis: When a baby born to an American soldier and a Korean woman is left at the 4077th, the staff tries to find a home for the child.
episodes.title: Yessir, That's Our Baby

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye tries to give up alcohol for a week, and Charles tries to stop his sister from marrying a man he believes is beneath the family.
episodes.title: Bottle Fatigue

episodes.synopsis: Both Potter and Winchester come down with the mumps, and the surgeon assigned to fill in for them begins to crumble under the pressure of the job.
episodes.title: Heal Thyself

episodes.synopsis: When Potter is called away to Tokyo, Hawkeye is left in charge just as a horde of Korean refugees -- mostly children -- descend on the 4077th.
episodes.title: Old Soldiers

episodes.synopsis: Potter makes Hawkeye and BJ the camp's new morale officers, and Charles' surgical triumph turns to heartbreak for a young soldier.
episodes.title: Morale Victory

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye is pinned down under fire at an aid station at the front, along with a surgeon who constantly contradicts his medical opinions.
episodes.title: Lend a Hand

episodes.synopsis: The doctors call on psychiatrist Sidney Freedman when a decorated Asian-American soldier would rather commit suicide than be sent home.
episodes.title: Goodbye, Cruel World

episodes.synopsis: In this acclaimed episode, exhausted members of the 4077th have thought-provoking dreams informed by their wartime experiences.
episodes.title: Dreams

episodes.synopsis: BJ's dedication to his marriage is tested when he falls for Aggie O'Shea, a famous war correspondent visiting the 4077th.
episodes.title: War Co-Respondent

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye sends the Army a bill for his services, and Charles learns something about Korean medicine when he shares tips with three local doctors.
episodes.title: Back Pay

episodes.synopsis: When a tough-as-nails colonel arrives at the 4077th on April Fool's Day, the pranks escalate as he grows less tolerant of the fun.
episodes.title: April Fools

episodes.synopsis: On his way to Seoul, Hawkeye is held at gunpoint by an enemy soldier who will stop at nothing to get help for his wounded comrade.
episodes.title: The Best of Enemies

episodes.synopsis: As the unit answers letters from schoolchildren in Hawkeye's hometown of Crabapple Cove, their perspectives on why they serve crystallize.
episodes.title: Letters

episodes.synopsis: For sanitary reasons, the medical staff decides to replace the old wood floor with cement, doing manual labor under the direction of foreman Klinger.
episodes.title: Cementing Relationships

episodes.synopsis: Margaret's father, a stern, by-the-book Army man, visits while the unit tries to hide a stolen side of beef a grateful patient gave them as a gift.
episodes.title: Father's Day

episodes.synopsis: The staff tries to prolong a fatally wounded soldier's life to spare his family painful Christmas memories; the unit hosts a party for local orphans.
episodes.title: Death Takes a Holiday

episodes.synopsis: The four seasons pass as Potter toasts the new year, squad members bet on a baseball pennant race, Father Mulcahy grows corn, and Margaret knits.
episodes.title: A War for All Seasons

episodes.synopsis: Klinger finds out that his ex-wife is marrying his best friend just as a retention officer tries to push the soldiers in the unit to re-enlist.
episodes.title: Your Retention, Please

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and B.J. try to help an immigrant Marine whose mother faces deportation; Winchester uses his clout to procure luxuries for himself.
episodes.title: Tell It to the Marines

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye tries to lure a nurse into his arms with a vintage bottle of wine; Potter finds a way to circumvent an Army ban on a much-needed anesthesia.
episodes.title: Taking the Fifth

episodes.synopsis: During an explosion, Klinger saves Charles's life, causing Charles to feel indebted; B.J. is injured in the blast, and Hawkeye distrusts his doctor.
episodes.title: Operation Friendship

episodes.synopsis: When a heat wave washes over the 4077th, everyone handles it -- or suffers through it -- in their own unique and personal ways.
episodes.title: No Sweat

episodes.synopsis: Klinger starts a camp newspaper; when a surplus of tongue depressors is delivered to the unit, Hawkeye finds a meaningful way to use the extras.
episodes.title: Depressing News

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye wagers that he can go "jokeless" through an entire day, but the challenge grows harder when Winchester kisses up to a hated visiting colonel.
episodes.title: No Laughing Matter

episodes.synopsis: As B.J. faces a lonely wedding anniversary, Hawkeye plans a special surprise for him; an insulted commander reacts to Charles with violence.
episodes.title: Oh, How We Danced

episodes.synopsis: When her old pal visits the unit, Margaret is blissfully ignorant of her friend's hidden alcoholism. Hawkeye crosses the line with a prank on Charles.
episodes.title: Bottoms Up

episodes.synopsis: When word of Potter's high blood pressure gets out, it's everyone's kindness that nearly kills him; Klinger has a bad reaction to a malaria medicine.
episodes.title: The Red/White Blues

episodes.synopsis: When Hawkeye suffers from inexplicable sneezing, Potter calls in an expert to see whether the root of the problem might be psychological.
episodes.title: Bless You, Hawkeye

episodes.synopsis: A visit from Cardinal Reardon propels Father Mulcahy to make the camp more presentable. Hawkeye and B.J. must deliver harsh news to a noble young GI.
episodes.title: Blood Brothers

episodes.synopsis: The unit enjoys a gift of fresh vegetables, and Radar shares cheer in a letter, but Potter's mood is dark when Klinger breaks his eyeglasses.
episodes.title: The Foresight Saga

episodes.synopsis: A near-death experience causes Winchester to deal with his mortality; when Potter rotates the duty roster, Hawkeye takes charge of the mess tent.
episodes.title: The Life You Save

episodes.synopsis: A touring USO company brings the promise of levity and laughter to the 4077th, but can the show go on when the star showgirl needs emergency surgery?
episodes.title: That's Show Biz - Part 1

episodes.synopsis: A performance by a group of USO entertainers not only lightens spirits but creates bittersweet romances as the troupe concludes its visit.
episodes.title: That's Show Biz - Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Father Mulcahy reaches out to a soldier who traded tags with a dead GI and lives under a cloud of guilt; Hawkeye and Margaret help a jilted soldier.
episodes.title: Identity Crisis

episodes.synopsis: When rumors imply that the unit may be split up and members reassigned, the staff of the 4077th acts badly to ward off recruitment to a new division.
episodes.title: Rumor at the Top

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye pens a scorching letter to President Truman criticizing the war, and the 4077th jumps through hoops to get a new water heater.
episodes.title: Give 'em Hell, Hawkeye

episodes.synopsis: Col. Potter signs up for driving lessons from Klinger, and B.J. turns gambler in order to send much-needed extra cash back home.
episodes.title: Wheelers and Dealers

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye reunites two brothers fighting on opposite sides in the war, and Charles antagonizes the camp by refusing to share his stateside newspapers.
episodes.title: Communication Breakdown

episodes.synopsis: When Hawkeye's new camera is stolen, Klinger retrieves it from the black market -- and is promptly arrested and charged with the theft himself.
episodes.title: Snap Judgment

episodes.synopsis: When Klinger chooses Charles to be his court-martial defense counsel, Hawkeye and B.J. set out to discover who really stole Hawkeye's camera.
episodes.title: Snappier Judgment

episodes.synopsis: On the day after Christmas, Col. Potter tries to boost morale by ordering the officers and enlisted personnel to swap places for the day.
episodes.title: 'Twas the Day After Christmas

episodes.synopsis: Delirious with a high fever, Klinger communicates with a young soldier whose spirit lingers after his body has expired.
episodes.title: Follies of the Living -- Concerns of the Dead

episodes.synopsis: Margaret's plans to spend her birthday in Tokyo go awry, and the doctors of the 4077th work overtime to help a wounded cow deliver her calf.
episodes.title: The Birthday Girls

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye loses his cool when a war correspondent cavalierly glorifies the war, and B.J. tries to fix a motorcycle given to him by a wounded GI.
episodes.title: Blood and Guts

episodes.synopsis: A soldier who's gone AWOL desperately seeks sanctuary in the 4077th's mess tent after Father Mulcahy holds his church service there.
episodes.title: A Holy Mess

episodes.synopsis: Charles suffers from a toothache, and Hawkeye suspects racism is at work when African Americans comprise most of one combat unit's casualties.
episodes.title: The Tooth Shall Set You Free

episodes.synopsis: After making a mistake in the O.R., Col. Potter summons Dr. Freedman for help. Meanwhile, Charles declares his own war on Hawkeye and B.J.
episodes.title: Pressure Points

episodes.synopsis: Frightened for his life while under heavy bombardment at a frontline aid station, Hawkeye writes out his final will and testament.
episodes.title: Where There's a Will, There's a War

episodes.synopsis: The enlisted personnel suck up to Hawkeye, B.J. and Charles in order to win their recommendations for promotion -- but one GI has a different tactic.
episodes.title: Promotion Commotion

episodes.synopsis: When he saves a renowned boxing champ -- and a childhood idol of Father Mulcahy's -- from a stroke, Hawkeye becomes an instant media darling.
episodes.title: Heroes

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye tries desperately to reach his ailing father by phone, and Col. Potter challenges some Marines to a bowling competition.
episodes.title: Sons and Bowlers

episodes.synopsis: Col. Potter wants to paint a group portrait of the 4077th, but an ongoing feud between Hawkeye, Charles and B.J. thwarts his efforts.
episodes.title: Picture This

episodes.synopsis: Paymaster Hawkeye lands in hot water when Klinger's new pet goat eats the 4077th's payroll, and Charles has his own money problems.
episodes.title: That Darn Kid

episodes.synopsis: Margaret and her nurses prepare to be inspected by a visiting colonel, and Hawkeye's wandering eye gets him in trouble with Nurse Kellye.
episodes.title: Hey, Look Me Over

episodes.synopsis: The doctors get dressed up for a Halloween party but end up trading ghost stories in the OR while tending to newly arrived patients.
episodes.title: Trick or Treatment

episodes.synopsis: An Army specialist tries to convince a stranded North Korean pilot to defect, and Charles falls for a French nurse with a checkered past.
episodes.title: Foreign Affairs

episodes.synopsis: Weary of hearing about what a great practical joker his predecessor Trapper John was, B.J. pulls out all the stops to prank everyone in camp.
episodes.title: The Joker Is Wild

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye makes a sobering discovery when he delivers the eulogy for a nurse he dated, and Klinger tries to tempt Charles with a business venture.
episodes.title: Who Knew?

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and Winchester scramble when people start believing a rumor they spread that Marilyn Monroe is coming to visit the 4077th.
episodes.title: Bombshells

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and the camp plan a surprise party for Col. Potter when his mortgage back home gets paid off, and B.J. treats a GI wounded by a sniper.
episodes.title: Settling Debts

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye schemes to get his hands on a steamy movie to screen in camp, and a wounded general declares the 4077th an alcohol-free zone.
episodes.title: The Moon Is Not Blue

episodes.synopsis: Klinger's excited to unveil a ringer for a footrace against the 8063rd, but it doesn't go as planned; Winchester connects with a stuttering soldier.
episodes.title: Run for the Money

episodes.synopsis: United Nations delegates from England, India and Sweden visit the 4077th, and the handsome Swede attempts to fend off advances from Margaret.
episodes.title: U.N., the Night and the Music

episodes.synopsis: Potter learns some disconcerting personal news about his visiting son-in-law; Charles is bugging B.J. and Hawkeye with his loud snoring.
episodes.title: Strange Bedfellows

episodes.synopsis: Margaret deals with a sudden case of laryngitis, while Hawkeye cares for a patient whose father, a general, refuses to leave the 4077th.
episodes.title: Say No More

episodes.synopsis: Potter struggles to cope with mounting evidence that an old friend and fellow colonel put the lives of many soldiers in danger.
episodes.title: Friends and Enemies

episodes.synopsis: A severely wounded North Korean soldier and the American GI who shot him seek understanding while recovering in neighboring beds at the 4077th.
episodes.title: Give and Take

episodes.synopsis: Hawkeye and Houlihan bicker over what to include in a time capsule marking their time in Korea; a young Korean woman is suspected of being a sniper.
episodes.title: As Time Goes By

episodes.synopsis: With the war finally over, Hawkeye and the 4077th gang are getting ready to head home.  Everyone wants to leave, but no one wants to say goodbye.
episodes.title: Goodbye, Farewell and Amen
